text: hello my name is VI Singh principal
specialist technical account manager for
databases here at
AWS in this video I'm going to discuss
about postl 12 and of Life post SQL 12
and of standard support for Aurora and
RDS postd SQL Amazon RDS extended
support benefits of posst SQL version 16
and finally a POS SQL 16 demonstration
video let's start with understanding
what is it mean by Community post SQL
end of life the post SQL Global
Development Group releases a new measor
version containing new features about
once a
year in the similar fashion every year
Community post SQL reaches end of life
for a given major version for an example
in no
2024 postl 12 Reed end of
support after the community end of life
date post SQL databases will be no
longer getting update bug fixes or
security
patches typically a major version is
supported for 5 years since its date of
release when a poster SQL version
reaches end of life users are
recommended to upgrade their databases
to newer supported version
now let's learn about Aurora RDS POS SQL
and of standard support Aurora and RDS
post SQL 12 will reach end of standard
support on February 28th
2025 Aurora post SQL will continue
release patches for extended support
versions while RDS releases new minor
versions with buck fixes and CV patches
for extended supported vers
we will learn more about Amazon RDS
extended support in next
slide after February 28th you can still
create Aurora pository SQL long-term
support
12.9 and
12.20 and RDS POS equal 12.22 databases
that will automatically enroll in
extended
support restoring post Cas equal 12
database snapshots we will have an
option to disable RDS extended support
please keep in mind if RDS extended
support is disabled database will be
forced
upgrade if upgrade fails database will
remain in extended support enabled and
will continue being
charged Amazon RDS extended support
allows to continue running RDS databases
on major version past and of standard
support for an additional cost
charges for Aurora and RDS POS equal 12
version will start from March 1st
2025 under RDS extended support RDS
provides critical security updates and
Bug fixes for Aurora and Os po SQL
databases after end of exard support
date it's important to note that RDS
does not provide any new features during
extended support
RDS ex standard support supports the
duplicated versions for up to three
years from the end of exard support
charges for this feature depends on AWS
region where RDS is hosted vcpu of the
instance and number of the years of
calendar year since standard support
expired there is a requirement of
versions to be in extended support
Aurora post requires version 12.9
long-term support or
12.20 while RDS for positive SQL
requires version
12.22 now let's learn about benefits of
POS SQL version
16 in post SQL 16 there are significant
performance improvements across various
key areas let's start with performance
improvements in query planner in this
release the query query planner gains
the performance for full and right
joints generates more optimized plans
for queries involving aggregate
functions with distinct or order by
Clauses and optimize the execution of
Windows functions leading to more
efficient
operation the release of posal 16 also
brings significant improvements to bulk
loading this is applicable to both
single and concurrent operations us
using the copy command starting from
version 16 tools that utilize L PQ such
as pql now have support for load
balancing at the connection level a new
Option has been added to the utility
that is load balance hosts which can be
used for load
balancing vacuum operation has been
improved in post equal 16 it comes with
enhancements to the vacuum strategy that
reduces the necessity of Full Table
freezes in postle 16 performance boosts
also come from the introduction of CPU
acceleration through simd technology for
both x86 and arm
architectures some of the Improvement in
logical replication in posco 16 are B
directional replication replication from
a standby and performance enhancements
for logical replication please note that
the ability to have logical replication
from a standby applies only for RDS POS
SQL and it does not apply for Aurora
posst
SQL posst SQL 16 introduces pgstat IO
view a source of IO metrics enabling
in-depth inspection of IO access
patterns the PG stat all tables view
offers comprehensive statis
pertaining to every table within the
present
database in posto 16 release a new
attribute is appended to this view this
attribute records a new time time column
that is last sequential scan indicating
the time of the last scan
table similarly in PG stat all indexes
view has a new column appended that is
last index scan which indicates the time
of the last index scan for a particular
index in this release post SQL 16 also
makes Auto explain more rable by logging
values passed into parameterized
statements and improves the accuracy of
the query tracking algorithm using
by PG State statements and PG State
activity in terms of security post SQL
16 introduces several enhanced ments and
new features it has security focused
client connection parameters posl 16
introduces the requir Au function
empowering clients to specify the
authentication parameters they are
willing to accept from a
server postle 16 also has added support
for kbo's credential delegation please
note that being managed database
Services some of these features may not
apply to Aurora or RDS poql
databases now let's have a look at this
demonstration video showing the
difference in posst SQL 12 and 16
followed up by performance benchmarking
using p PG bench tool on my left side I
have RDS postgress equal 12 and I have a
postgress equal 16 in my right side as
we can see compared to posal 12 posal 16
has four more attributes for PG stat all
table views these new attributes are
last s scan last idx scan and TP new
page update and N Inc since vacuum
similarly PG all indexes has a new
column last index is SC added we also
see that there is a new V view PG stat
IU is added to posst SQL 16 which is not
present in posst SQL 12
now I will be performing benchmarking
using PG bench tool on RDS POG SQL 12
and 16
versions as you can see both of the
instances have similar Hardware
including same instance class and
storage size as well as storage type by
the end of the
benchmarking I found that posst SQL 12
served 24 89
transactions per second also called TPS
while post equ 16 served
2,641 TPS around 7% higher than post
equal 12 for similar
workloads I hope you found this
informative thanks for watching
